microSituations.title: I'm Lost
actions: Find nearest Tube station (look for red circle with blue bar)
Use Citymapper app (best for London transport)
Ask at info desk or police station
Look for major landmarks (Big Ben, London Eye, Tower Bridge)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't panic - London is walkable. Most central attractions are within 30min walk of each other.

microSituations.title: Public Transport
actions: Get Oyster card or use contactless card - ¬£2.50-¬£3.20 per journey
Validate card on yellow readers before boarding
Tube runs 5am-12:30am, buses 24hr on main routes
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid taxis during rush hour (7-9am, 5-7pm). Tube is faster and cheaper.

microSituations.title: Taxi / Ride Share
actions: Black cabs: meter required, expensive (¬£15-30 short trips)
Walk between close stations (Covent Garden-Leicester Square = 2min walk vs ¬£2.50 tube)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Use Tube for most trips. Taxis only for late night or heavy luggage.

microSituations.title: Quick Bite
actions: Meal deals at supermarkets: ¬£5-8 (sandwich, snack, drink)
Food markets: Borough Market (lunch), Camden Market
Pret A Manger, Itsu: ¬£6-10 quick meals
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't eat at tourist trap restaurants. Walk 2 blocks away for better prices.

microSituations.title: Sit-Down Meal
actions: Tipping: 10-12.5% if service good, round up taxis, no tip for pubs
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Eat lunch like locals (12-2pm) for best deals. Dinner after 7pm.

microSituations.title: Dietary Restrictions
actions: Ask about allergens (UK law requires disclosure)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't assume - always ask. British restaurants are very accommodating.

microSituations.title: 15-30 Minutes
actions: Walk along South Bank (free, beautiful views)
Visit a local pub for a drink
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't rush. London is best experienced slowly.

microSituations.title: 1-2 Hours
actions: British Museum (free, book online to skip queue)
Tower of London (book online, visit 9am to avoid crowds)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid peak times (10am-2pm). Early morning or late afternoon is better.

microSituations.title: Half Day
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. Pick one area and explore deeply.

microSituations.title: Safety Concern
actions: Avoid: Some areas of East London late at night
Trust your instincts - leave if uncomfortable
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: London is generally safe, but stay alert in tourist areas (pickpockets).

microSituations.title: Scam / Suspicious
actions: Ignore: Fake ticket sellers near attractions
Don't give money to aggressive beggars
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Be polite but firm: 'No thanks' and keep walking.

microSituations.title: Lost Item
actions: Report to embassy if passport stolen
Cancel cards immediately if wallet stolen
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Keep copies of passport/ID separate. Use hotel safe for valuables.

microSituations.title: Essential Phrases
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't worry - English is the language, but politeness matters.

microSituations.title: Ordering Food
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't be embarrassed. Locals appreciate politeness.

microSituations.title: Asking for Help
actions: 'Mind the gap' (on Tube - watch your step)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: British people are helpful but appreciate politeness and queuing properly.

microSituations.title: Need Rest
actions: Find a park: Hampstead Heath, Hyde Park (free)
Caf√© break (coffee ¬£2-4, sit as long as you want)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't push through exhaustion. Rest is part of travel.

microSituations.title: Too Many Tourists
actions: Leave main areas: walk 10min away from Oxford Street
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Tourist areas are crowded for a reason, but real London is 2 blocks away.

microSituations.title: Overwhelmed by Choices
actions: Pick one thing: food OR museums OR shopping
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. One great experience beats ten rushed ones.

microSituations.title: If you have 15 minutes
actions: Try a random pub for a pint
Watch street performers at Covent Garden
Discover a tiny street you've never heard of

microSituations.title: If you want something social
actions: Join locals at a traditional pub
Visit a local market and chat with vendors
Attend a free concert (check local listings)

microSituations.title: If it's raining
actions: Pub culture: sit inside with a book

microSituations.title: If you want local flavor
actions: Find a neighborhood bistro away from center

microSituations.title: Advanced Navigation
actions: Citymapper app (better than Google Maps for London)
